entry.title: RFP ANNOUNCES LEADERSHIP APPOINTMENTS
entry.summary: In the KQEN Business Spotlight: Roseburg Forest Products recently announced the appointments of Tony Hamill as Chief Operations Officer and Vivek Karuppuswamy as Senior Vice President Human Resources and Labor. A company release said joining later this month, Hamill and Karuppuswamy bring a combined 50 years of operations and HR expertise to Roseburg’s leadership team...

entry.title: UCAN CANCELS CONTRACTS FOR THREE PORTA POTTY’S IN ROSEBURG
entry.summary: September 16, 2024 3:05 a.m. The United Community Action Network is canceling contracts with a vendor for providing three Porta Potty units in downtown Roseburg, effective October 1st. A notice provided by UCAN Executive Director Shaun Pritchard said the move is due to recent and ongoing vandalism and destruction. Units are at: *548 Northeast Jackson...

entry.title: LOCAL SALVATION ARMY TO BEGIN TAKING ANGEL TREE APPLICATIONS
entry.summary: September 16, 2024 2:50 a.m. The Roseburg Salvation Army will begin taking applications for its Angel Tree program soon. Captain Edith Dye-Mabie said Angel Tree is their annual Christmas toy program, to help those in need. Dye-Mabie said applications can be turned in throughout the month of October. entry.title: SLIGHT GROWTH ON HOMESTEAD COMPLEX FIRES
entry.summary: September 15, 2024 11:00 a.m. There has been only slight growth on the Homestead Complex fires over the past few days. An Umpqua National Forest update said there are still approximately 74 miles of uncontained fire edge. Firefighters are accessing and extinguishing hot spots and continue finding and suppressing spot fires outside the main fires....

entry.title: CONTAINMENT CONTINUES RISING ON DEVIL’S KNOB/MILEPOST 98 FIRES
entry.summary: September 15, 2024 10:40 a.m. Containment continues to rise on the Devil’s Knob and Milepost 98 fires. An update from Northwest Incident Management Team 13 said the Devil’s Knob Fire is up to 23 percent containment while the Milepost 98 Fire is 63 percent contained. Mop up and patrol continues around both fires as crews...

entry.title: Umpqua National Forest receives grant for forest health projects
entry.summary: UMPQUA NATIONAL FOREST — U.S. Department of Agriculture committed $4.89 million to the Elk Tribal and Community healthy forest restoration project in the Umpqua National Forest.

entry.summary: CURTIN—Douglas County Parks Department will close Pass Creek County Park and Campground in Curtin permanently Sept. 30.

entry.title: SUMMER 2024 FIRE RESTRICTIONS LIFTED AT CRATER LAKE NATIONAL PARK
entry.summary: September 13, 2024 3:40 a.m. The fire danger level within Crater Lake National Park has dropped from extreme to high due to recent moisture and predicted cooler temperatures. A National Park Service release said effective Friday, the park has rescinded the fire ban implemented on July 25th. Public Information Officer Marsha McCabe said to ensure...

entry.title: FIRE DANGER HAS DECREASED TO HIGH ON ODF LANDS
entry.summary: September 13, 2024 3:30 a.m. Following rain and cooler temperatures across southern Oregon, the fire danger level on lands protected by the Oregon Department of Forestry Southwest Oregon District decreased to High, effective Friday. Public Information Officer Natalie Weber said this affects 1.8 million acres of state, private, county, and Bureau of Land Management lands...

entry.title: PASS CREEK COUNTY PARK IS CLOSING
entry.summary: September 13, 2024 3:20 a.m. The Douglas County Parks Department has announced that Pass Creek County Park & Campground will be permanently closed on September 30th. A county release said this is the result of a combination of financial and operational challenges, including low occupancy rates and insufficient revenue to cover operating costs. This action...

entry.title: ADAPT ANNOUNCES CHIEF MEDICAL OFFICER’S RETIREMENT

entry.title: OSU EXTENSION WITH KOMBUCHA WORKSHOP IN OCTOBER
entry.summary: September 13, 2024 2:50 a.m. The Oregon State University Extension Service Master Food Preservers will have a workshop about Kombucha on Saturday, October 12th from 10:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. It will be held at the Extension office on Southeast Douglas Avenue in Roseburg. Attendees will learn how kombucha is made, fermentation techniques and more....
